cityPulse.title: City Pulse Mobility Dashboard
cityPulse.excerpt: A real-time transit monitor blending IoT data with municipal schedules.
cityPulse.description: Combines bus GPS feeds and pedestrian counters to help the Lviv city council evaluate service demand during peak hours. I architected the map visualisations in React, processed live data streams with WebSockets, and coordinated with UX researchers to ensure the dashboard works on public kiosks.

campusPlanner.title: Campus Planner 360
campusPlanner.excerpt: Scheduling assistant connecting students, labs, and equipment availability.
campusPlanner.description: Built for a software engineering studio course to reduce conflicts between lab sessions and project teams. I introduced role-based access, integrated PostgreSQL with Prisma, and automated notifications through Telegram bots used by 300+ students.

greenRoutes.title: Green Routes Lviv
greenRoutes.excerpt: Open-source web app suggesting low-emission commute options.
greenRoutes.description: Volunteered with an environmental NGO to help residents compare walking, cycling, and public transport routes. I led the frontend migration to Next.js, implemented energy impact scoring, and wrote documentation so new volunteers can contribute quickly.

about.title: Solving community challenges through thoughtful code
about.description: I am a third-year Computer Science student at Lviv Polytechnic National University, exploring how data and design can accelerate sustainable urban development.

story.heading: From robotics club to civic tech
story.paragraph1: I entered tech by soldering sensors for a school robotics club. That tinkering spirit pushed me toward programming tools that connect real-world data with people who rely on it daily.
story.paragraph2: Now I specialise in full-stack TypeScript, geographic visualisations, and accessible UI systems. Beyond classes, I mentor first-year students, co-lead a campus coding guild, and document processes so every teammate can contribute with confidence.
